commitResults.messageTitle: Rename the file, added greet and exit
added echo commands and will end the program if user types the command bye
added the ability to read and store user input and print them as list. in addition, logo is added
created the Task class and refactored the code to use Task instead of String
added the ability to mark tasks as done and the ability to change the status back to not done.
Added ToDo as a subclass to Task and refactored the code base to use ToDo class over Task class
added Deadline class which is a subclass for Todo class. Added type behaviour to every class. Added todo as a command
rebranded with new icon and new end text
changed the output for mark, unmarked and list so that it shows the type of task

added toString to Task and its subclass to enable polymorphism. refactored the main code based to take advantage of polymorphism. Fixed minor formatting issues. Lastly, added the deadline functionality
added the functionality where users can add events now
refactored text-ui-test
added a few more testcases
refactored the inputs to have its own methods
added exceptions to handle errors
added delete feature and updated the testcase
changed task to abstract class and added enums
refactored the code such that event, deadline, and todo is a subclass of task which will conform to LSP.
added descriptive header for classes and methods
Add new toFileString method for file format
commitResults.messageBody:
The code lacks a method for converting task data into a format suitable
for file storage. This absence hinders future development for persisting
tasks to a file.

To support file read and write operations, a method is required to
consistently represent tasks as strings that can be easily saved
and retrieved.

Introduce a new `toFileString` method that formats task data as
"TaskType | StatusIcon | Description | From-To" depending on the
Task type.
This format will be used for file storage.

This structure ensures that all relevant task details are included
in a consistent format, paving the way for reliable file I/O
operations in future development.

This is an initial step toward implementing task persistence,
and further changes will involve handling file read/write operations.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add file read and write functionality
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, tasks are not saved or loaded from a file.

Implement file reading and writing to persist task data.

This ensures tasks are saved and restored between sessions.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add empty file content check in parseTask method
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, the chatbot will throw an exception if the file is
empty.

Updated `parseTask` method to handle empty file cases gracefully.

Improved robustness by ensuring tasks are
only parsed if file content is present.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add parseDateTime for date format validation
commitResults.messageBody:
The chatbot currently cannot correctly interpret date formats
and simply accepts any input without validation.

This behavior can lead to errors and confusion
when users input dates in various formats,
expecting the chatbot to understand them.

Implement the parseDateTime method, which attempts to parse the input
against a list of predefined date and time formats.
If none of the formats match, it throws a SilverWolfException,
prompting the user to check their input.

By validating and parsing date formats, the chatbot becomes more robust
and user-friendly, preventing incorrect inputs and
providing clear feedback when issues arise.

The change improves overall functionality and ensures that
date inputs are handled consistently across the application. In
addition, test cases has been updated to take into account of the
new date format.

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove unused LocalTime import
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, the java.time.LocalTime import is included
in the codebase, but it is not being used anywhere.

This import needs to be removed to clean up the code
and avoid confusion about unnecessary dependencies.

Remove the LocalTime import to maintain a clean and efficient codebase.

This is done to follow best practices of only including relevant
imports, improving code readability and maintainability.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor chatbot for improved OOP design
commitResults.messageBody:
The chatbot does not fully adhere to Object-Oriented
Programming principles.

The current code structure may be difficult to maintain,
extend, and understand.

Refactor the code to better utilize OOP concepts
such as encapsulation, inheritance, and polymorphism.

Adhering to OOP principles makes the codebase more modular,
scalable, and easier to manage.

Improved code structure facilitates future enhancements and debugging.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor codebase into packages for improved organization
commitResults.messageBody:
The codebase has all classes in a single package,
making it difficult to navigate and maintain.

Organizing classes into packages improves code readability and
maintainability. It also simplifies the management of
related functionalities and dependencies.

Action taken:
- Create `silverwolf.command` package and move command-related classes
(AddCommand, DeleteCommand, UnmarkCommand) into it.
- Create `silverwolf.parser` package and move parsing classes (
Parser, DateTimeParser) into it.
- Create `silverwolf.ui` package for UI-related classes
and `silverwolf.storage`
 package for storage-related classes.
- Introduce `silverwolf.task` package for task management classes
 (Task, TaskList).
- Create `silverwolf.exception` package and move any custom
exceptions into the package

This organization clarifies the project structure and helps in scaling
the project as more functionalities are added.
Each package now contains related classes,
enhancing modularity and reducing potential for code conflicts.

No changes to class functionality,
only restructuring for better code management.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'add-gradle-support' of https://github.com/AlekKwek18/ip
Set up Gradle for project build automation
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, the SilverWolf project is built and run
manually without an automated build system.

Integrate Gradle into the project by merging the `add-gradle-support`
branch into `master`. Configure the `build.gradle` file to support
building and running the SilverWolf project using Gradle.

Gradle is a powerful and flexible build automation tool that
simplifies dependency management, compilation, and execution processes.
Setting it up early in the project helps streamline development.

This setup enables automated builds and prepares the project for
future enhancements, such as automated testing and
deployment processes using Gradle.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JUnit tests for TaskList and Storage classes
commitResults.messageBody:
The `Todo`,`TaskList` and `Storage` classes lack
comprehensive unit tests.

Ensuring the functionality of these classes through tests
is crucial for maintaining reliability and catching bugs early.

Implement unit tests for `TaskList` to verify task management operations
such as addition, retrieval, and size management.
Add tests for `Storage` to check saving and loading functionality,
handle empty files, and manage invalid paths.

Testing edge cases and typical use cases ensures that the classes
perform as expected under various conditions.
Improving comments provides clarity and facilitates easier maintenance.

Tests are designed to cover a broad range of scenarios,
including error handling and boundary conditions.

commitResults.messageTitle: Package the application as an executable JAR file
commitResults.messageBody:
The application is not yet distributed as an executable JAR file,
making it less convenient for users to run the application.

Packaging the application as a JAR file simplifies
 distribution and execution for end-users, providing a single,
easily runnable file.

Package the app into an executable JAR file following the provided
guidelines. Ensure that the JAR file can be run from a command line
with `java -jar "{filename}.jar"`. Make necessary adjustments to
the project setup to support JAR packaging.

Creating an executable JAR file streamlines deployment and
execution processes, making it easier for users to run the
application without additional setup.

The JAR file will not be committed to the Git repository.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JavaDoc comments for code documentation
commitResults.messageBody:
Enhance the code documentation by updating JavaDoc comments.

Provide comprehensive comments for most non-private classes and
methods, and for
 non-trivial private methods. This update improves code clarity
and maintainability by ensuring that the purpose and functionality
 of various components are clearly documented.

No changes to code functionality were made; only updates to
documentation were performed to facilitate better understanding
 and future maintenance.
